  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        Perhaps content/browser/permissions/permission_service_context.cc::OnConnectionError needs to check... something? Having weird things happen when you delete the current profile is somewhat.... unsurprising though. I think Feedback is a Chrome app that is presumably trying to access some permission, and when it's being closed as the profile is deleted it's accessing the now-gone BrowserContext object?<span class="line"><!---->Perhaps content/browser/permissions/permission_service_context.cc::OnConnectionError needs to check... something? Having weird things happen when you delete the current profile is somewhat.... unsurprising though. I think Feedback is a Chrome app that is presumably trying to access some permission, and when it's being closed as the profile is deleted it's accessing the now-gone BrowserContext object?<!----></span><br><br>+permissions folks, can you take a look? This doesn't appear to be web-accessible so I'm marking it as Low severity - it needs a rather unlikely combination of user actions to trigger.<span class="line"><!---->+permissions folks, can you take a look? This doesn't appear to be web-accessible so I'm marking it as Low severity - it needs a rather unlikely combination of user actions to trigger.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Based on the attached video, it looks like this is still reproducible with 93.0.4577.0, which includes<span class="line"><!---->Based on the attached video, it looks like this is still reproducible with 93.0.4577.0, which includes<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/3024090<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3024090"><!---->crrev.com/c/3024090<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> After that change, the PermissionServiceContext is either destroyed with an RFH or when the RPH is cleaned up. Based on comments in the code, my understanding is that Browser instances, among other things, should keep Profile instances alive.<span class="line"><!----> After that change, the PermissionServiceContext is either destroyed with an RFH or when the RPH is cleaned up. Based on comments in the code, my understanding is that Browser instances, among other things, should keep Profile instances alive.<!----></span><br><br>My intuition is that this is not happening for the Feedback WebUIDialog (as it is not a browser, and does not increase refcounts). This does not sound like a permissions-specific issue, I would expect most frame or process-bound services to break if you pull the Profile/BrowserContext from under them.<span class="line"><!---->My intuition is that this is not happening for the Feedback WebUIDialog (as it is not a browser, and does not increase refcounts). This does not sound like a permissions-specific issue, I would expect most frame or process-bound services to break if you pull the Profile/BrowserContext from under them.<!----></span><br><br>CC'ing Siddhartha and Rohit who might have more context of Profile / BrowserContext lifetimes in relation to RPH and RFHs.<span class="line"><!---->CC'ing Siddhartha and Rohit who might have more context of Profile / BrowserContext lifetimes in relation to RPH and RFHs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Context from <span class="line"><!---->Context from <!----></span>Issue 1232324<span class="line"><!---->Issue 1232324<!----></span>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br><br><br>Chrome Version: <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: <!----></span>c09c0792bb28a3a186c2f1efbabc34a7417d4a49<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c09c0792bb28a3a186c2f1efbabc34a7417d4a49"><!---->c09c0792bb28a3a186c2f1efbabc34a7417d4a49<!----></a><br>Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version)<span class="line"><!---->Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version)<!----></span><br>OS: Linux<span class="line"><!---->OS: Linux<!----></span><br><br>What steps will reproduce the problem?<span class="line"><!---->What steps will reproduce the problem?<!----></span><br>(1) Open Chromium and click Experiments icon > Send Feedback<span class="line"><!---->(1) Open Chromium and click Experiments icon &gt; Send Feedback<!----></span><br>(2) Open a guest profile (or any other profile)<span class="line"><!---->(2) Open a guest profile (or any other profile)<!----></span><br>(3) Close the original profile window without closing the feedback window<span class="line"><!---->(3) Close the original profile window without closing the feedback window<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected result?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected result?<!----></span><br>Either the Feedback window is closed or the browser context is not destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->Either the Feedback window is closed or the browser context is not destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>What happens instead?<span class="line"><!---->What happens instead?<!----></span><br>Browser crashes with the DCHECK below. Without DCHECKs any interaction with the feedback window (e.g., clicking on a link) causes a crash. It appears that browser dialogs expect the browser context to be alive as long as the dialog lives but it does not appear to be the case: <span class="line"><!---->Browser crashes with the DCHECK below. Without DCHECKs any interaction with the feedback window (e.g., clicking on a link) causes a crash. It appears that browser dialogs expect the browser context to be alive as long as the dialog lives but it does not appear to be the case: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_dialogs.h;l=101;drc=23ee32391a2364af6e4ed7573f4b2d2e380e441b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" Check failed: false. rph_with_bc_reference : {  pl='{ chrome://feedback/ }' lsn=2 }<span class="line"><!---->1580073:1580073:0723/083643.526694:FATAL:browser_context_impl.cc(88)] Check failed: false.         I'm also raising severity to Medium - closing a sole browser window from which Feedback was opened whilst Feedback remains open is sufficient to trigger a UaF. I don't think this merits a High severity as it is a slightly unusual interaction pattern and not web-accessible, but it doesn't feel on the same par as say a UaF in the sandboxed renderer.<span class="line"><!---->I'm also raising severity to Medium - closing a sole browser window from which Feedback was opened whilst Feedback remains open is sufficient to trigger a UaF. I don't think this merits a High severity as it is a slightly unusual interaction pattern and not web-accessible, but it doesn't feel on the same par as say a UaF in the sandboxed renderer.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 15<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1231764#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      dominickn@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->dominickn@chromium.org<!----></span>

      Sat, Jul 24, 2021, 12:50 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Jul 24, 2021, 12:50 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1231764#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Jul 24, 2021, 12:50 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1231764#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Jul 24, 2021, 12:50 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This issue is a classic memory safety problem: a use-after-free caused by accessing a Profile which is already gone. UaFs in the browser process are especially scary: they potentially allow malicious code to take over the browser process and therefore all of Chrome / Chrome OS if an attacker is able to place code they want executed in the memory region which has been freed and is now being incorrectly accessed. Most of the full-chain takeover vulnerabilities that we see combine a number of small use-after-frees etc. like this one together in order to hop from JavaScript code running in a renderer to a full takeover of the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->This issue is a classic memory safety problem: a use-after-free caused by accessing a Profile which is already gone. UaFs in the browser process are especially scary: they potentially allow malicious code to take over the browser process and therefore all of Chrome / Chrome OS if an attacker is able to place code they want executed in the memory region which has been freed and is now being incorrectly accessed. Most of the full-chain takeover vulnerabilities that we see combine a number of small use-after-frees etc. like this one together in order to hop from JavaScript code running in a renderer to a full takeover of the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>This particular UaF is mitigated by the fact that users have to be manipulated into performing the series of actions to expose it, but we still want any memory safety issues in the browser process fixed as soon as possible.<span class="line"><!---->This particular UaF is mitigated by the fact that users have to be manipulated into performing the series of actions to expose it, but we still want any memory safety issues in the browser process fixed as soon as possible.<!----></span><br><br>It broadly makes sense to me that ShowWebDialog() itself should return a window that will be close when its underlying profile is deleted. However, I'm not sure how feasible that is. Can you follow up with the right folks to discuss the best approach to addressing this issue is?<span class="line"><!---->It broadly makes sense to me that ShowWebDialog() itself should return a window that will be close when its underlying profile is deleted. However, I'm not sure how feasible that is. Can you follow up with the right folks to discuss the best approach to addressing this issue is?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {

          text-decoration: underline;

              Discard

              Convert issue

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;

    margin: 0;

    line-height: 1.6;

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;

  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;

    }
  }

          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */

        }

          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it

        Perhaps content/browser/permissions/permission_service_context.cc::OnConnectionError needs to check... something? Having weird things happen when you delete the current profile is somewhat.... unsurprising though. I think Feedback is a Chrome app that is presumably trying to access some permission, and when it's being closed as the profile is deleted it's accessing the now-gone BrowserContext object?<span class="line"><!---->Perhaps content/browser/permissions/permission_service_context.cc::OnConnectionError needs to check... something? Having weird things happen when you delete the current profile is somewhat.... unsurprising though. I think Feedback is a Chrome app that is presumably trying to access some permission, and when it's being closed as the profile is deleted it's accessing the now-gone BrowserContext object?<!----></span><br><br>+permissions folks, can you take a look? This doesn't appear to be web-accessible so I'm marking it as Low severity - it needs a rather unlikely combination of user actions to trigger.<span class="line"><!---->+permissions folks, can you take a look? This doesn't appear to be web-accessible so I'm marking it as Low severity - it needs a rather unlikely combination of user actions to trigger.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Based on the attached video, it looks like this is still reproducible with 93.0.4577.0, which includes<span class="line"><!---->Based on the attached video, it looks like this is still reproducible with 93.0.4577.0, which includes<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/3024090<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3024090"><!---->crrev.com/c/3024090<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> After that change, the PermissionServiceContext is either destroyed with an RFH or when the RPH is cleaned up. Based on comments in the code, my understanding is that Browser instances, among other things, should keep Profile instances alive.<span class="line"><!----> After that change, the PermissionServiceContext is either destroyed with an RFH or when the RPH is cleaned up. Based on comments in the code, my understanding is that Browser instances, among other things, should keep Profile instances alive.<!----></span><br><br>My intuition is that this is not happening for the Feedback WebUIDialog (as it is not a browser, and does not increase refcounts). This does not sound like a permissions-specific issue, I would expect most frame or process-bound services to break if you pull the Profile/BrowserContext from under them.<span class="line"><!---->My intuition is that this is not happening for the Feedback WebUIDialog (as it is not a browser, and does not increase refcounts). This does not sound like a permissions-specific issue, I would expect most frame or process-bound services to break if you pull the Profile/BrowserContext from under them.<!----></span><br><br>CC'ing Siddhartha and Rohit who might have more context of Profile / BrowserContext lifetimes in relation to RPH and RFHs.<span class="line"><!---->CC'ing Siddhartha and Rohit who might have more context of Profile / BrowserContext lifetimes in relation to RPH and RFHs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #5: yes, I agree with your analysis. I'm currently discussing with security folks, but I agree this is not a permissions specific issue but a manifestation of the feedback dialog not listening to profile events.         Context from <span class="line"><!---->Context from <!----></span>Issue 1232324<span class="line"><!---->Issue 1232324<!----></span>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br><br><br>Chrome Version: <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: <!----></span>c09c0792bb28a3a186c2f1efbabc34a7417d4a49<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c09c0792bb28a3a186c2f1efbabc34a7417d4a49"><!---->c09c0792bb28a3a186c2f1efbabc34a7417d4a49<!----></a><br>Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version)<span class="line"><!---->Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version)<!----></span><br>OS: Linux<span class="line"><!---->OS: Linux<!----></span><br><br>What steps will reproduce the problem?<span class="line"><!---->What steps will reproduce the problem?<!----></span><br>(1) Open Chromium and click Experiments icon > Send Feedback<span class="line"><!---->(1) Open Chromium and click Experiments icon &gt; Send Feedback<!----></span><br>(2) Open a guest profile (or any other profile)<span class="line"><!---->(2) Open a guest profile (or any other profile)<!----></span><br>(3) Close the original profile window without closing the feedback window<span class="line"><!---->(3) Close the original profile window without closing the feedback window<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected result?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected result?<!----></span><br>Either the Feedback window is closed or the browser context is not destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->Either the Feedback window is closed or the browser context is not destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>What happens instead?<span class="line"><!---->What happens instead?<!----></span><br>Browser crashes with the DCHECK below. Without DCHECKs any interaction with the feedback window (e.g., clicking on a link) causes a crash. It appears that browser dialogs expect the browser context to be alive as long as the dialog lives but it does not appear to be the case: <span class="line"><!---->Browser crashes with the DCHECK below. Without DCHECKs any interaction with the feedback window (e.g., clicking on a link) causes a crash.           Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Severity-Low Security_Severity-Medium Pri-1

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Severity-Low Security_Severity-Medium Pri-1

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I'm also raising severity to Medium - closing a sole browser window from which Feedback was opened whilst Feedback remains open is sufficient to trigger a UaF. I don't think this merits a High severity as it is a slightly unusual interaction pattern and not web-accessible, but it doesn't feel on the same par as say a UaF in the sandboxed renderer.<span class="line"><!---->I'm also raising severity to Medium - closing a sole browser window from which Feedback was opened whilst Feedback remains open is sufficient to trigger a UaF. I don't think this merits a High severity as it is a slightly unusual interaction pattern and not web-accessible, but it doesn't feel on the same par as say a UaF in the sandboxed renderer.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1231764#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        This depends on how to fix it. <span class="line"><!---->This depends on how to fix it. <!----></span><br><br>If we want to fix the issue at the low level (implementation of the ShowWebDialog function), I am not the right person. Since this function depends on the user profile, I think it makes sense to self close when the profile is destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->If we want to fix the issue at the low level (implementation of the ShowWebDialog function), I am not the right person. Since this function depends on the user profile, I think it makes sense to self close when the profile is destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>If we want to fix at the app level, I will see what to do with the Feedback app.<span class="line"><!---->If we want to fix at the app level, I will see what to do with the Feedback app.<!----></span><br><br>BTW,   how this issue is related to security?<span class="line"><!---->BTW,   how this issue is related to security?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 15<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1231764#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      dominickn@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/550204252" title="dominickn@chromium.org"><!---->dominickn@chromium.org<!----></a>
      dominickn@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->dominickn@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1231764#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Jul 24, 2021, 12:50 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1231764#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Jul 24, 2021, 12:50 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This issue is a classic memory safety problem: a use-after-free caused by accessing a Profile which is already gone. UaFs in the browser process are especially scary: they potentially allow malicious code to take over the browser process and therefore all of Chrome / Chrome OS if an attacker is able to place code they want executed in the memory region which has been freed and is now being incorrectly accessed. Most of the full-chain takeover vulnerabilities that we see combine a number of small use-after-frees etc. like this one together in order to hop from JavaScript code running in a renderer to a full takeover of the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->This issue is a classic memory safety problem: a use-after-free caused by accessing a Profile which is already gone. UaFs in the browser process are especially scary: they potentially allow malicious code to take over the browser process and therefore all of Chrome / Chrome OS if an attacker is able to place code they want executed in the memory region which has been freed and is now being incorrectly accessed. Most of the full-chain takeover vulnerabilities that we see combine a number of small use-after-frees etc. like this one together in order to hop from JavaScript code running in a renderer to a full takeover of the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>This particular UaF is mitigated by the fact that users have to be manipulated into performing the series of actions to expose it, but we still want any memory safety issues in the browser process fixed as soon as possible.<span class="line"><!---->This particular UaF is mitigated by the fact that users have to be manipulated into performing the series of actions to expose it, but we still want any memory safety issues in the browser process fixed as soon as possible.<!----></span><br><br>It broadly makes sense to me that ShowWebDialog() itself should return a window that will be close when its underlying profile is deleted. However, I'm not sure how feasible that is. Can you follow up with the right folks to discuss the best approach to addressing this issue is?<span class="line"><!---->It broadly makes sense to me that ShowWebDialog() itself should return a window that will be close when its underlying profile is deleted. However, I'm not sure how feasible that is. Can you follow up with the right folks to discuss the best approach to addressing this issue is?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>

          </tbody>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        }

          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;

          margin: auto;

        }

          overflow-y: auto;

        }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          Security_Severity-Low FoundIn-91 OS-Chrome OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Lacros

        Perhaps content/browser/permissions/permission_service_context.cc::OnConnectionError needs to check... something? Having weird things happen when you delete the current profile is somewhat.... unsurprising though. I think Feedback is a Chrome app that is presumably trying to access some permission, and when it's being closed as the profile is deleted it's accessing the now-gone BrowserContext object?<span class="line"><!---->Perhaps content/browser/permissions/permission_service_context.cc::OnConnectionError needs to check... something? Having weird things happen when you delete the current profile is somewhat.... unsurprising though. I think Feedback is a Chrome app that is presumably trying to access some permission, and when it's being closed as the profile is deleted it's accessing the now-gone BrowserContext object?<!----></span><br><br>+permissions folks, can you take a look? This doesn't appear to be web-accessible so I'm marking it as Low severity - it needs a rather unlikely combination of user actions to trigger.<span class="line"><!---->+permissions folks, can you take a look? This doesn't appear to be web-accessible so I'm marking it as Low severity - it needs a rather unlikely combination of user actions to trigger.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        Based on the attached video, it looks like this is still reproducible with 93.0.4577.0, which includes<span class="line"><!---->Based on the attached video, it looks like this is still reproducible with 93.0.4577.0, which includes<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/3024090<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3024090"><!---->crrev.com/c/3024090<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> After that change, the PermissionServiceContext is either destroyed with an RFH or when the RPH is cleaned up. Based on comments in the code, my understanding is that Browser instances, among other things, should keep Profile instances alive.<span class="line"><!----> After that change, the PermissionServiceContext is either destroyed with an RFH or when the RPH is cleaned up. Based on comments in the code, my understanding is that Browser instances, among other things, should keep Profile instances alive.<!----></span><br><br>My intuition is that this is not happening for the Feedback WebUIDialog (as it is not a browser, and does not increase refcounts). This does not sound like a permissions-specific issue, I would expect most frame or process-bound services to break if you pull the Profile/BrowserContext from under them.<span class="line"><!---->My intuition is that this is not happening for the Feedback WebUIDialog (as it is not a browser, and does not increase refcounts). This does not sound like a permissions-specific issue, I would expect most frame or process-bound services to break if you pull the Profile/BrowserContext from under them.<!----></span><br><br>CC'ing Siddhartha and Rohit who might have more context of Profile / BrowserContext lifetimes in relation to RPH and RFHs.<span class="line"><!---->CC'ing Siddhartha and Rohit who might have more context of Profile / BrowserContext lifetimes in relation to RPH and RFHs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Context from <span class="line"><!---->Context from <!----></span>Issue 1232324<span class="line"><!---->Issue 1232324<!----></span>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br><br><br>Chrome Version: <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: <!----></span>c09c0792bb28a3a186c2f1efbabc34a7417d4a49<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c09c0792bb28a3a186c2f1efbabc34a7417d4a49"><!---->c09c0792bb28a3a186c2f1efbabc34a7417d4a49<!----></a><br>Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version)<span class="line"><!---->Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version)<!----></span><br>OS: Linux<span class="line"><!---->OS: Linux<!----></span><br><br>What steps will reproduce the problem?<span class="line"><!---->What steps will reproduce the problem?<!----></span><br>(1) Open Chromium and click Experiments icon > Send Feedback<span class="line"><!---->(1) Open Chromium and click Experiments icon &gt; Send Feedback<!----></span><br>(2) Open a guest profile (or any other profile)<span class="line"><!---->(2) Open a guest profile (or any other profile)<!----></span><br>(3) Close the original profile window without closing the feedback window<span class="line"><!---->(3) Close the original profile window without closing the feedback window<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected result?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected result?<!----></span><br>Either the Feedback window is closed or the browser context is not destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->Either the Feedback window is closed or the browser context is not destroyed.<!----></span><br><br>What happens instead?<span class="line"><!---->What happens instead?<!----></span><br>Browser crashes with the DCHECK below. Without DCHECKs any interaction with the feedback window (e.g., clicking on a link) causes a crash. It appears that browser dialogs expect the browser context to be alive as long as the dialog lives but it does not appear to be the case: <span class="line"><!---->Browser crashes with the DCHECK below.         I'm also raising severity to Medium - closing a sole browser window from which Feedback was opened whilst Feedback remains open is sufficient to trigger a UaF. I don't think this merits a High severity as it is a slightly unusual interaction pattern and not web-accessible, but it doesn't feel on the same par as say a UaF in the sandboxed renderer.<span class="line"><!---->I'm also raising severity to Medium - closing a sole browser window from which Feedback was opened whilst Feedback remains open is sufficient to trigger a UaF. I don't think this merits a High severity as it is a slightly unusual interaction pattern and not web-accessible, but it doesn't feel on the same par as say a UaF in the sandboxed renderer.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
